content.description: From the start holds, continue straight up, using the dirty horizontal crack and then following the vertical crack up to the topout.
content.location: On the south side of the playground, facing the canyon. To the right of Mom Packed My Lunch.

content.description: This route starts at the bottom right of the bottom boulder, gains a horizontal rail to traverse left and follows a crack in the top boulder to top out. The horizontal rail can be a bit chossy, but the other holds are pretty good.
content.location: This is the first routes you will see when you first reach the Playground. It climbs up the two stacked boulders.

content.description: Crimps and finger jams. Start with a left hand out to a crimp and the right hand pulling sideways on a crack too think to put fingers in. It widens a few moves in and allows for jams. Top out on the top of the playground.
content.location: North side of the playground. Afternoon shade.

content.description: Low crux up to an undercling, and then it's jugs to the topout. Sit start. Hard to protect because a crashpad is bigger than the ledge.
content.location: South side of The Playground. This side of the rock faces the canyon.

content.description: Start on the short block left of the crack. Work up the crack and over the lip to top out.
content.location: On the north side of the Playground. To the right of Playground Bully.

content.description: This area has the largest amount of routes in the Middle East. Named for the abundance of fun climbs at this location. It is important to check for loose rock while you are climbing in this area.
